  note = {Mapping scholarly debates is an important genre of what can be called Knowledge Domain Analytics {(KDA)} technology â€“ i.e. technology which combines both quantitative and qualitative methods of analysing specialist knowledge domains. However, current {KDA} technology research has emerged from diverse traditions and thus lacks a common conceptual foundation. This paper reports on the design of a {KDA} ontology that aims to provide this foundation. The paper then describes the argumentation extensions to the ontology for supporting scholarly debate mapping as a special form of {KDA} and demonstrates its expressive capabilities using a case study debate.},
